resource.name: ITU Key ICT Indicators
resource.description:
ITU Key ICT indicators for developed and developing countries and the world (totals and penetration rates).  From 2005 to 2017 featuring end-2017 estimates.

The developed/developing country classifications are based on the UN M49, see: http://www.itu.int/en/ITU-D/Statistics/Pages/definitions/regions.aspx

Regions are based on the ITU regions, see: http://www.itu.int/en/ITU-D/Statistics/Pages/definitions/regions.aspx

NOTES: 
1.  The data was originally in messy Excel tables and has been manually reshaped to long format, which may have introduced some errors.
2.  This data has changed significantly between the 2016 and 2017 editions, including historical data as far back as 2005, but no explanation for this has been given and the data is not marked as changed.
3.  The figures in the source data are 8 decimal places but have been rounded to 3 decimal places here.
4.  The data for Least Developed Countries (LDCs) was first added in 2017, with full history going back to 2005.

resource.name: Internet Connections
resource.description: The number of Internet connections in NZ of various different types and by various features. A sub-set of the Stats NZ annual ISP survey that has been running since 2011.

resource.name: Low Content Taxonomy aggregated stats
resource.description: Statistics of number of domains categorized by CENTR content categories

resource.name: Recent Internet Users
resource.description: Data extracted from the Household Use of Information and Communication Technology 2012 survey. Outlines how many people (split into multiple characteristics) have used the internet in the past 12 months.

resource.description: This Data was first Produced in October 2017 for the Digital Divide Map (previously hosted at digitaldivide.nz)

resource.name: .nz SSL scan results
resource.description: Aggregated data collected while checking HTTPS support across all .nz domains.

resource.name: Web Index
resource.description:
The Web Index is designed and produced by the World Wide Web Foundation. It is the world’s first measure of the World Wide Web’s contribution to social, economic and political progress in countries across the world.  

This dataset is only for 2014 and is the Ranks and Scores at Index, Sub-Index and Component level.  It does not include earlier years or go down to the indicator level but may do at some point in the future.

resource.name: Percentage of Internet technology coverage by Postcode in New Zealand
resource.description:
Using the Broadband Map NZ and LINZ AIMS Address Position data from the LINZ Data Service, the percentage of addresses that have each Internet Technology available for connection is presented by the given geographic boundary. 

The first data snapshot shows the percentages as Quarter 4, 2020.
Subsequent data releases are quarterly based on the calendar year.

Where does the Broadband Map NZ data come from?
Data is provided to the Broadband Map on a voluntary basis from a number of wholesale Internet Service Providers (ISPs) that operate networks in New Zealand. This data is collected, processed and updated on the map on a regular basis.

Limitations
The Broadband Map does not have 100% coverage of Internet availability as a small number of companies have not provided their data. Furthermore, the data provided may not be 100% accurate as local conditions can often affect both availability and speed. We welcome any provider of copper, fibre, mobile or wireless infrastructure to contact us and provide the information for the map.

Data Sources:
LINZ AIMS address – AIMS: Address Position LINZ DATA Service https://data.linz.govt.nz/layer/53355-aims-address-position/ "AIMS Address Position" by Land Information New Zealand is licensed under CC BY 4.0.

resource.name: nz Zone Scan
resource.description: Multiple metrics obtained for the monthly zone scan run across all .nz domain names in the .nz registry
columns_description: High level descriptor of what the metric is
Time when the zone scan finished
Describes what unit is used in the metric
Total number of nameservers in the zone scan
Description of what the metric is
The numeric value of the metric
Time when the zone scan started
Number of total domains in the given zone scan

resource.name: Online Transaction Safety
resource.description: The percentages of people who 'feel safe/very safe when using the internet for online transactions'. Measures include gender, race, age, income, qualification etc. Data from Statistics NZ's General Social Survey Conducted April 2014 - March 2015.

resource.name: Household Use of ICT - Value of purchases
resource.description: Data pertaining to the amount individuals had spent online in the four weeks before the census was conducted. This question was contained in the Household Use of Information and Communication Technology 2012 survey. This data set includes answers from both 2012 and 2009.

resource.name: Internet Service Providers
resource.description: The percentages of Internet Service Providers with various attributes and providing various features.  Includes information on IPv6 uptake and barriers to IPv6.  A sub-set of the Stats NZ annual ISP survey that has been running since 2011.

resource.name: NZRS Business Perception Research
resource.description: Data relating to how New Zealand businesses use of the internet collected by Colmar Brunton on behalf of .nz in 2013, 2014 and 2015. Due to the addition, alteration and deletion of questions over the years, some questions will not have a response from every given year.

resource.name: Cloud Readiness Index
resource.description: The Asia Cloud Computing Association’s (ACCA) Cloud Readiness Index (CRI) measures the cloud readiness of economies along 10 parameters.  This dataset covers the years 2012, 2014 and 2016.
